page.title: 06BUILDINGS_ LONGHILL MILL
page.content: Just outside{Lhanbryde}is{Longhill {Mill}and farm leased by{Innes Estates to the Knight family in 1905 at an annual rent, then, of Â£90. {* * * A fine example of a{19th c.mill (date above the kiln window{1891},but, behind the wheel,{1735})it has:3 pairs of millstones in line,a pit wheel by Thompson & Co.Dundee, two pairs of grinding stones with cast iron bridge pieces,a kiln ceiling of lath and plaster and a bushel measure with the date of its first test(the year the mill was rebuilt after { 9 VR 1 fire gutted the original){B U S H E L {* * *} Disused since 1967 due to lack of demand for produce and trouble with the water supply,the mill is still worth visiting when Mr Knight has time to show you round.
